doctor's companion.text: Doctor's companion — If your starting deck includes The Doctor, you may have two commanders if one has doctor’s companion.

landwalk.text: Landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land with the specified land type.)

umbra armor.text: Umbra armor — Totem armor variant, often grants totem armor and other boosts.

freerunning.text: Freerunning — When you cast this spell after attacking with a creature, [effect]. (Appears in Universes Beyond.)

spree.text: Spree — You may pay additional costs for multiple effects as you cast this spell.

saddle.text: Saddle [Cost] (You may tap a creature you control to help pay for this card’s saddle cost.)

shadow.text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked only by creatures with shadow.)

warp.text: Warp — You may cast this spell for its warp cost; it enters the battlefield. At the beginning of the next end step, exile it. You may later cast it from exile for its mana cost.

station.text: Station — [Ability] Tap an untapped creature you control: Put charge counters equal to that creature’s power on this permanent. Activate only as a sorcery. At a specified number, this permanent becomes a creature with abilities.

devour.text: Devour N (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. It enters the battlefield with N +1/+1 counters for each creature sacrificed.)

offspring.text: Offspring — When this creature dies, create a copy of it with lesser power and toughness. (Un-set ability.)

impending.text: Impending N — [cost]: This permanent enters with N time counters and isn't a creature until the last is removed. At the beginning of your end step, remove a time counter.

gift.text: Gift — This permanent enters with an additional bonus or shared effect with another card. (e.g., Gift of Compleation.)

harmonize.text: Harmonize — When this creature enters or dies, another permanent gains a bonus or triggers an additional ability. (Flavorful tag.)

exhaust.text: Exhaust — After activation, this permanent can’t be untapped for a set number of turns or until a condition is met.

max speed.text: Max Speed — Used in Un-sets to denote haste + evasion. (Not a rules-meaningful term in black-bordered sets.)

fear.text: Fear (This creature can’t be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

mobilize.text: Mobilize N (Whenever this creature attacks, create N 1/1 red Warrior creature tokens tapped and attacking. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.)

double team.text: Double team (When this creature attacks, if it’s not a token, conjure a duplicate into your hand. It loses double team.)

activate.text: Activate — See rule 601.2: Pay costs to activate an activated ability; put it on the stack.

attach.text: Attach — The action of putting an Aura or Equipment onto a permanent.

cast.text: To cast a spell, you put it on the stack, choose modes, targets, and pay its mana and additional costs. It then resolves or gets countered.

counter.text: To counter a spell or ability is to cancel it before it resolves. A countered spell goes to the graveyard.

create.text: To create a token is to put it onto the battlefield. Tokens can be creatures, treasures, clues, food, etc.

destroy.text: To destroy a permanent is to put it into its owner’s graveyard. Indestructible permanents cannot be destroyed.

discard.text: To discard a card is to put it from your hand into your graveyard. Some effects require discarding as a cost or effect.

double.text: Double — When this permanent enters, double a certain stat, value, or count. (Appears on specific cards with alternate effects.)

exchange.text: Exchange — Swap control or characteristics of two permanent or cards as instructed.

exile.text: To exile a card is to put it outside the game. It stays exiled unless another effect brings it back.

adapt.text: Adapt N — [Cost]: If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put N +1/+1 counters on it.

support.text: Support — Put +1/+1 counter on target creature and/or another creature.

play.text: To play a land or cast a spell is to put it into action. Playing a land doesn’t use the stack.

regenerate.text: To regenerate is to prevent a creature from dying. The next time it would be destroyed, it taps and is removed from combat instead.

reveal.text: To reveal a card is to show it to all players, usually from your hand or the top of your library.

sacrifice.text: To sacrifice a permanent is to put it into its owner's graveyard. Sacrificing can’t be prevented.

shuffle.text: To shuffle means to randomize the order of cards in a library or other zone. Often done after searches.

tap.text: To tap a card is to turn it sideways to indicate it’s been used. Commonly used for mana or attacking.

untap.text: To untap is to rotate a tapped card back to its upright position. Happens during the untap step or via effects.

vote.text: Vote — Players choose among options; result based on majority, sometimes with multiple votes allowed.

time travel.text: Time travel (Un-set only: advance or rewind turns. For silver-border formats only.)

goad.text: Goad — Until your next turn, this creature attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.

transform.text: Transform (Turn a double-faced card to its other side. This action is often linked to triggers or conditions.)

surveil.text: Surveil N (Look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number into your graveyard and the rest back on top in any order.)

planeswalk.text: Planeswalk (Move to a new plane card. Triggers planechase abilities.)

mill.text: Mill N (Put the top N cards of a player’s library into their graveyard.)

learn.text: Learn (You may reveal a Lesson card from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.)

connive.text: Connive (Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

venture into the dungeon.text: Venture into the dungeon (Enter the first room of a dungeon or advance to the next room if already inside one.)

exert.text: Exert (When you exert a creature, it won’t untap during your next untap step. In exchange, it usually gets a bonus.)

open an attraction.text: Open an Attraction (Reveal cards from your attraction deck until you reveal one that isn’t already open. Put it onto the battlefield.)

food.text: Food — Artifact tokens with 'T, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.'

discover.text: Discover — Arena-specific: Reveal cards until you find a nonland, then put it into your hand.

abandon.text: Abandon (Move away from the current plane card without triggering a planeswalk effect.)

explore.text: Explore — Reveal the top card of your library. If it’s a land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

treasure.text: Treasure — Artifact tokens with 'T, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.'

roll to visit your attractions.text: Roll to visit your Attractions (At the beginning of your main phase, roll a six-sided die to see which attractions you visit.)

set in motion.text: Set in motion (Start a phenomenon card’s effect at the beginning of a Planechase game.)

fateseal.text: Fateseal N (Look at the top N cards of an opponent’s library. You may put any number of them on the bottom and the rest on top in any order.)

manifest.text: Manifest (Put a card from your library onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. It can be turned face up if it’s a creature card.)

populate.text: Populate (Create a token that’s a copy of a creature token you control.)

detain.text: Detain (Until your next turn, target nonland permanent an opponent controls can’t attack, block, or activate its abilities.)

investigate.text: Investigate (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with '2, Sacrifice this: Draw a card.')

monstrosity.text: Monstrosity N — [Cost] (If this creature isn’t monstrous, put N +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

clash.text: Clash (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts it on top or bottom. Higher mana value wins the clash.)

scry.text: Scry N (Look at the top N cards of your library. Put any number on the bottom and the rest on top in any order.)

incubate.text: Incubate N (Create an Incubator token with N +1/+1 counters. You may transform it later into a 0/0 Phyrexian artifact creature.)

proliferate.text: Proliferate (Choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters, then give each another of those counters.)

meld.text: Meld (You may meld two specific cards if you both own and control them. They form a single oversized card with combined characteristics.)

fight.text: Fight — Two target creatures deal damage equal to their power to each other.

bolster.text: Bolster N (Choose a creature you control with the least toughness and put N +1/+1 counters on it.)

assemble.text: Assemble (Put a Contraption card into one of your sprockets.)

amass.text: Amass N (Put N +1/+1 counters on an Army you control. If you don’t control one, create a 0/0 black Army creature token first.)

cloak.text: Cloak (To cloak a card is to put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature with ward {2}. It can be turned face up if it's a creature card.)

suspect.text: Suspect (Mark a creature as suspect. It can’t block while suspected.)

collect evidence.text: Collect evidence — Arena-specific: Create a Clue token.

role token.text: Roles are colorless Aura enchantment tokens with 'Enchant creature'. Only one Role per creature per player can be attached at a time. If another Role is created for the same creature by the same player, the old Role is put into the graveyard.

plot.text: Plot [Cost] (You may pay [Cost] and exile this card. You may cast it on a later turn for free.)

heist.text: Heist (Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn if you attacked this turn.)

forage.text: Forage (Choose up to X cards in graveyards, then shuffle them into their owners’ libraries.)

manifest dread.text: Manifest dread — Look at the top two cards of your library. Manifest one face down as a 2/2 creature and put the other into your graveyard.

special.adventure: Adventure — A special card type allowing you to cast one half (the Adventure instant or sorcery) before the creature. After casting the Adventure part, the creature card is exiled and then can be cast. Common in Theros Beyond Death and Lord of the Rings (2020).
special.omen: Omen — A noncreature spell inset on a creature card. When cast as an Omen (instead of casting the creature), it's cast as an instant or sorcery, and when it resolves it is shuffled back into its owner's library instead of going to the graveyard. Introduced in Tarkir: Dragonstorm (2025).
special.companion: Companion is a special rule that allows you to have a companion card in your sideboard. If your starting deck meets the companion's condition, you can cast it from outside the game once per game.
special.monarch: Monarch is a designation a player can have. At the beginning of your end step, if you're the monarch, you draw a card. A player becomes the monarch by dealing combat damage to the current monarch.
special.initiative: The Initiative is a designation a player can have. When you take the Initiative, you venture into the Undercity. If you already have the Initiative, you instead venture deeper. The Initiative can be stolen by dealing combat damage to the player who currently has it.
special.city_blessing: The City's Blessing is a status you gain once you control ten or more permanents. Once you have it, you keep it for the rest of the game. Some cards have Ascend and become stronger if you have the City’s Blessing.

special_counters.finality: Finality Counter — If a permanent with a finality counter would die, exile it instead.
special_counters.shield: Shield Counter — If this permanent would be destroyed or dealt damage, remove a shield counter instead.
special_counters.stun: Stun Counter — If a permanent with a stun counter would untap, remove one instead.

special_tokens.lander: Lander Token — Artifact token with “{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this token: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.” Introduced in Edge of Eternities (2025).
special_tokens.blood: Blood Token — Artifact token with “{1}, {T}, Discard a card, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.” Introduced in Innistrad: Crimson Vow (2021).
special_tokens.map: Map Token — Artifact token with “{1}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Target creature you control explores.” Introduced in The Lost Caverns of Ixalan (2023).
special_tokens.treasure: Treasure Token — Artifact token with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.” Evergreen since Ixalan (2017).
special_tokens.gold: Gold Token — Artifact token with “Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.” Similar to Treasure but activation doesn’t require tapping.
special_tokens.clue: Clue Token — Artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.” Created by Investigate and related effects.
special_tokens.food: Food Token — Artifact token with “{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.” First appeared in Throne of Eldraine (2019).
special_tokens.incubator: Incubator Token — Artifact token with “{2}: Transform this artifact.” It transforms into a 0/0 Phyrexian artifact creature with N +1/+1 counters on it.
special_tokens.powerstone: Powerstone Token — Artifact token with “{T}: Add {C}. This mana can’t be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.” Introduced in The Brothers' War (2022).
special_tokens.junk: Junk Token — Artifact token with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn.”
special_tokens.shard: Shard Token — Enchantment token with “{2}, Sacrifice this enchantment: Scry 1, then draw a card.” Created by the Constellation mechanic (Kaldheim Commander decks).
special_tokens.role: Role Token — Enchantment Aura token with various keywords and abilities. Created by cards in Wilds of Eldraine (2023). Only one Role per creature per controller.

deathtouch.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

double strike.text: Double strike (This creature deals both first‑strike and regular combat damage.)

enchant.text: Enchant — [the enchanted permanent type] (This Aura enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)

equip.text: Equip [cost] (Attach this to target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery.)

first strike.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

flash.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

flying.text: Flying (This creature can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.)

haste.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

hexproof.text: Hexproof (This permanent can’t be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

indestructible.text: Indestructible (Effects that say “destroy” don’t destroy this.)

lifelink.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

menace.text: Menace (This creature can’t be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

protection.text: Protection from [quality] (This can’t be damaged, enchanted, equipped, blocked or targeted by anything [quality].)

reach.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

shroud.text: Shroud (This permanent can’t be the target of any spells or abilities.)

trample.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it’s attacking.)

vigilance.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn’t cause this creature to tap.)

ward.text: Ward [cost] (Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays [cost].)

intensity.text: Intensity — [Rule] where this spell or permanent becomes stronger the higher its intensity.

seek.text: Seek (Arena-only): Randomly select a card in your library that matches certain criteria. You don't shuffle afterward.

conjure.text: Conjure (Arena-only): Create a copy of a specific card and put it into your hand, graveyard, or library.)

perpetual.text: Perpetual (Effects with this keyword apply permanently, even across zone changes.)

spellbook.text: Spellbook (When triggered, you may choose one of several predefined cards to conjure into your hand.)

materialize.text: Materialize (Arena-only): Exile a card, then create a token copy of it.
